isis.stitle: 7 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER PS110-7, PS145-7 - DISASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT

step1.para: Begin mainshaft disassembly by cutting the lockwire and removing reverse gear ( Figure 39).

note.para: Always remember to wear safety glasses to protect your eyes.

step1.para: Remove the snap ring, 6th gear, and the internal and external thrust washers ( Figure 40).

figure.caption: Figure 40. Remove Snap Ring, 6th Gear and Thrust Washers

note.para: The internal thrust washer teeth face toward the center of the washer. The external thrust washer teeth face away from the washer. Always check washers for wear. Replace if necessary.

step1.para: Remove 5th gear ( Figure 41). There are two thrust washers and a snap ring inside the gear. All gears except reverse gear contain gear bore snap rings. There is no need to remove a gear bore snap ring unless the gear is being replaced.

Remove the snap ring and the 4th-5th shift collar. Remove the snap ring and 4th gear. Inside the gear are two thrust washers and a snap ring. Inspect the thrust washers for wear; replace if necessary ( Figure 42).

figure.caption: Figure 42. Remove Snap Ring and 4th Gear

step1.para: Remove 3rd gear. Inside are two thrust washers and a snap ring ( Figure 43). Inspect the thrust washers for wear; replace if necessary. There is no need to remove the gear snap ring.

Remove the mainshaft snap ring and 2nd-3rd shift collar. Remove the next snap ring and 2nd gear. Also remove and inspect the two thrust washers; replace if necessary. There is no need to remove the gear snap ring ( Figure 44).

figure.caption: Figure 44. Remove Snap Ring and 2nd Gear

step1.para: Remove 1st gear. There are two thrust washers and a snap ring inside the gear. Inspect the thrust washers; replace if necessary. There is no need to remove the gear snap ring ( Figure 45).
Remove the two snap rings and the 1st-reverse collar from the shaft ( Figure 46).

figure.caption: Figure 46. Remove Snap Rings and 1st-Reverse Collar

step1.para: Remove the pocket bearing with a suitable puller ( Figure 47).
The 4th-5th and 6th-7th shift collars and gears have TaperLok gear locks. They draw gears into perfect alignment to eliminate gear jump-out ( Figure 48).
Clean all parts and inspect them for wear or damage. Replace if necessary ( Figure 49).

figure.caption: Figure 49. Clean and Inspect All Parts

important.para: If a gear is damaged, its mating countershaft gears may also be damaged. So any time you replace a mainshaft gear, replace its mating countershaft gears as well.
